titleproper.value: Guide to the Center For Student Life Records <num>RG.12.16</num>

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2019-01-17T20:29:48</date>

extent.value: in 1 record carton, 1 manuscript box, and 1 flat box

abstract.value: The Records of Center for Student Life consist of guides for campus programs for incoming students, as well as memorabilia from past clubs and events. The Center for Student Life engages New York University students to foster a sense of community and support students' transition into campus life.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Center for Student Life Records; RG 12.16; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University.
Transferred by David Vogelsang, Executive Director, Center for Student Life  in May, 2018. The accession number associated with this gift is 2018.016.

The Center for Student Life engages New York University students during their transition into campus life. The Center serves as a central point of information and campus-wide events, and helps students navigate various aspects of the university, including clubs, fraternities, sororities, class activities boards, and community service opportunities.

The Records of the Center for Student Life consist of guides for campus programs for incoming students, and memorabilia from past university clubs and events. The program guides document President's Service Award ceremonies, parent activities, and student orientation from 1989 to 2018.
